009package imagingbook.common.ij;
010
011import java.awt.Polygon;
012
013import ij.gui.EllipseRoi;
014import ij.gui.OvalRoi;
015import ij.gui.PointRoi;
016import ij.gui.PolygonRoi;
017import ij.gui.Roi;
018import ij.gui.RotatedRectRoi;
019import ij.process.FloatPolygon;
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
021
022/**
023 * This class defines static ROI-related utility methods
024 * to interface with ImageJ.
025 * 
026 * @author WB
027 *
028 */
029public class RoiUtils {
030        
031        private RoiUtils() {}
032        
033        /**
034         * Retrieves the outline of the specified ROI as an array of {@link Pnt2d}
035         * points with {@code int} coordinates. Note that unless the ROI is of type
036         * {@link PolygonRoi} or {@link PointRoi} only the corner points of the bounding
037         * box are returned. Interpolated contour points are returned for a instance of
038         * {@link OvalRoi}.
039         * 
040         * @param roi the ROI
041         * @return the ROI's polygon coordinates
042         */
043        public static Pnt2d[] getOutlinePointsInt(Roi roi) {
044                Polygon pgn = roi.getPolygon();
045                Pnt2d[] pts = new Pnt2d[pgn.npoints];
046                for (int i = 0; i < pgn.npoints; i++) {
047                        pts[i] = Pnt2d.PntInt.from(pgn.xpoints[i], pgn.ypoints[i]);
048                }
049                return pts;
050        }
051        
052        /**
053         * Retrieves the outline of the specified ROI as an array of {@link Pnt2d}
054         * points with {@code double} coordinates. Returned coordinates are measured
055         * relative to the pixel center, e.g., (5.0, 3.0) is assumed to be in the middle
056         * of pixel (5, 3). This method retrieves ROI points with
057         * {@link Roi#getFloatPolygon()} but applies type-dependent correction for
058         * consistent point rendering.
059         * 
060         * @param roi the {@link Roi}
061         * @return the ROI's outline coordinates
062         */
063        public static Pnt2d[] getOutlinePointsFloat(Roi roi) {
064                final double offset = (needsOffset(roi)) ? -0.5 : 0.0;
065                FloatPolygon pgn = roi.getFloatPolygon();
066                Pnt2d[] pts = new Pnt2d[pgn.npoints];
067                for (int i = 0; i < pgn.npoints; i++) {
068                        pts[i] = Pnt2d.PntDouble.from(pgn.xpoints[i] + offset, pgn.ypoints[i] + offset);
069                }
070                return pts;
071        }
072        
073        /**
074         * Returns true if the given {@link Roi} instance requires a half-pixel
075         * offset applied to the points returned {@code Roi#getFloatPolygon()}
076         * for proper rendering. This fixes a problem (bug) in ImageJ to make
077         * sure that all ROI types render consistently. This is the situation
078         * (as of IJ 1.53u):
079         * - Line, FreehandLine, SegmentLine, Point, MultiPoint: no offset needed (OK),
080         * - Elliptic, Oval, Polygon, Rectangle, RotRectangle: 0.5 pix offset needed.
081         * 
082         * @param roi a ROI instance
083         * @return true if offset needed
084         */
085        private static boolean needsOffset(Roi roi) {
086                int type = roi.getType();
087                if (roi instanceof EllipseRoi) return true;
088                if (roi instanceof OvalRoi) return true;
089                if (roi instanceof PolygonRoi && type == Roi.POLYGON) return true;
090                if (roi instanceof Roi && type == Roi.RECTANGLE) return true;
091                if (roi instanceof RotatedRectRoi) return true;
092                return false;
093        }
094        
095        /**
096         * Converts an array of 2D points (of type {@link Pnt2d}) to
097         * a {@link PointRoi} instance.
098         * 
099         * @param points v
100         * @return a {@link PointRoi} instance
101         */
102        public static PointRoi toPointRoi(Pnt2d[] points) {
103                PointRoi roi = new PointRoi();
104                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
105                        roi.addPoint(p.getX(), p.getY());
106                }
107                return roi;
108        }
109        
110}
